inn1.comm: full and on middle, Qdk punches it back to the bowler
Taylor shortens his length outside off, Qdk has a leaden-footed slash and misses. The ball did not bounce as much as the batsman expected it to

Taylor shells a return catch. It results in a four. Full again, this gets stuck in the pitch. Qdk looks to drive and ends up lobbing it back to the bowler. Taylor, perhaps, was late to react. He goes with both hands but can only finger-tip it away to the boundary
back of a length and angled in, Qdk is cramped for room. He hangs back and punches this 135.4ks ball to mid-on
overpitched and outside off, driven in the gap between the covers and mid-off
good length and angled in, Amla defends it solidly
full and angling away outside off, pushed straight to mid-off
veering into the pads, diverted behind square
back of a length and outside off, left alone. Carry? Not so encouraging. Looks like the pitch is playing sluggish already
half-volley outside off and creamed! Amla flows forward and drives it in the gap at the covers, but the outfield, which had received rain in the last couple of days, is slow. Just three
pitched up and angled around off, tapped back to Holder on the front foot
good length and angling away just a shade outside off, Qdk presses half-forward and pokes it towards the midwicket region, off the inside edge
short and skiddy. Angling in from over the wicket, not much bounce again. Amla camps back and drops it near his feet
this does bounce! Banged in on off, Amla gets on top of the bounce and punchily defends it back
pretty full and aimed at off, no swing, Amla gives it respect and bunts it to mid-on
back of a length and on off, Amla picks it away to the right of the mid-on fielder
full outswinger outside off, leaves Qdk. Another leaden-footed swish and a miss
wide yorker, Qdk hangs back and jabs it to point
Played! overpitched and outside off, no swing at all, Amla stands tall and punchily drives it past the covers. He punches gloves with his partner
Holder escapes punishment! Rank long-hop outside off, Amla stretches out and slaps it straight to point
leg-stump half-volley now, flicked sweetly to fine leg
length and outside off, angled away, Qdk clips it past mid-on for four. Not middled. It came off the inside half
back of a length and angled away outside off, defensively dropped in front of point
shorter and outside off, chopped to point
back of a length, keeps Amla back, defended towards square leg
sprayed full and down leg - errant ball - glanced fine, there is protection in the deep on the leg side
dug in short and outside off, sits up, Qdk, who was batting out of the crease, slap-pulls it over short midwicket
back of a length and outside off, blocked to the off side
yorker from round the stumps, veers in, past the off stump, can't be jammed out
oh, what was that? Wide, wide full toss, well past the tramline. The slower cutter went awfully wrong
wide yorker outside off, inside the tramline, this. Qdk can't slice it away. Beaten
Holder goes wide of the crease and angles it outside off, Amla now waits and angles it down to third man. Soft hands
full and outside off from round the stumps, sliced to the covers
It's a slow surface, but Holder uses his height to generate extra bounce on this inducker. De Kock aimed to pull and then chopped it past the leg stump. For four. Holder isn't pleased
drop-and-run single behind square for one. Good running between the wickets
pitched up and outside off, Amla slaps it straight to KP at short extra cover
Holder goes wide of the crease and digs it outside off, perhaps an effort ball, Amla did not get on top of the bounce. Played to KP at short extra again
back of a length on middle, defended
errs in length. Overpitched on middle, drilled back down the ground. Put away
shortens his length outside off, chopped to point
shortish and angled in, kept out
back of a length and angled in, punched.. Pierces mid-off and extra cover
hits through the line imperiously. He is exceptional at this. Back of a length and outside off, slapped through the covers. Right off the middle of the bat
angling into the pads from over the stumps, picked away through backward square leg
full and coming in, clipped to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Amla stands up and punches through the covers, Holder runs to his right from mid-off and hunts it down
back of a length and angled in, Amla uses his wrists and runs it smartly to third man
stump-to-stump line, blocked back to the bowler
short and wide, helped to third man for one
straighter one, seam-up ball, pushed down to long-off
flat and full on off, picked away to square leg
this one swerves away from Amla, kncukle ball, run away past slip
shorter and wider outside off, skids on, chopped to third man
slides on straight, kept out
fired on off, no turn, bunted to long-on
back of a length and outside off, Amla has ample time to drink his tea, read his morning newspaper, watch a movie play it down to third man
cutter, change of pace, full on middle, Qdk waits and jabs it towards point
short, stops on Qdk, he stands tall and punches early to the covers
Qdk aims to force this short ball away, he is tucked up for room. Chopped to the covers

bowled'em. Ricky breaks the opening stand, pumps his fist, and roars. Back of a length on middle, Qdk wants to force this one away to leg with a pull. He can only drag a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. The middle stump is pegged back
full and outside off, the left-hander watches it through to the keeper. Good finish to the Powerplay from Ricky

Narine pins Amla lbw. The spinner strikes in his second over on return. Two wickets in three balls. Dangled up on the middle stump, Amla had shuffled across off. He nearly topples over. Narine hits the pad with this knuckle ball and traps him in front of middle. Amla flicked and missed. Gone
fired on off, tapped back to the bowler
patted to the covers on the front foot. Nice touch play
full and outside off, driven to long-off
full on middle, played back to the bowler
this is the skiddy one, zips off the surface, AB jabs it down the ground
full and outside off, left alone. The lack of bounce defeats Ramdin behind the stumps
angled in on middle, good length from round the stumps, blocked cautiously
angled in on off, Rossouw presents a straight bat and defends it back to the bowler

nicked and falls short of a diving Ramdin. Slowish pitch. Probing line outside off, full length. The batsman pushes defensively with no feet movement and edges it, drops short of Ramdin, diving to his left, in front of lone slip
veering into the hips, tucked through backward square leg for a couple
back of a length and angled in, pushed back to Ricky
pushed on the pads, knocked to midwicket
whippy punch from outside off to long-on
full and turns in, knuckle ball, prodded into the pitch
now he unfurls the normal offbreak, which turns away. Poked out. Nearly brought silly-point into play
an appeal for lbw! Narine and Holder converge, and they decide against a review. Tossed full, and hits the pad. I guess that pitched outside leg. Good call from ump Wilson
skiddy knuckle ball at 93ks. I din't see much of it in the IPL. Bunted back to Narine
Ricky goes wide of the crease and angles it outside off, helped to third man
full on off, jabbed to mid-off
very full on off, jammed out to the midwicket region
short and angled in, punched out to the covers
slower one, change-up, the batsman waits and taps it back, Ricky fumbles and deflects the ball towards mid-off
Ricky goes wide of the crease, again. The over ends the same way it began with a touch down to third man. Slower one at 119ks
glanced off the pads to short fine leg
lobbed up outside off, dabbed past lone slip
skids into the left-hander, perhaps another knuckle ball. Kept out
tossed on middle, defended to midwicket
ducks back into the left-hander, knuckle ball, flicked through square leg on the back foot
full and outside off, slapped out to long-off
full and angled in, nudged to mid-off for a quick one
angled in, slower one, AB uses his wrists and dabs to third man
short and angled in on middle, only waist-high, well, not even waist-high, pulled behind square
tucked past square leg. Umpire Wilson swerves out of the way of the throw. Ramdin sees the funny side of it
back of a length and outside off, punched out to the covers
slower ball outside off, guided down to third man with an angled bat
a good length outside off, nagging lines. Rossouw defends with a straight bat, angled ever so slightly to guide to point
change in pace. One of a thousand to come in this series. Pushed away to cover
another slower ball, full and wide outside off. Steered to point
third in a row. Slow and full, driven to cover
looking for the yorker, but misses. A low full toss outside off is driven back to the bowler
slower ball to finish. Good length outside off, chopped to point. A maiden
nice start. A fullish length outside off, AB rocks onto the back foot and punches to sweeper cover
a bit of turn. Tossed up outside off, short enough for RR to push off the back foot, to deep cover.
skids on with the arm on off and middle. Drilled to long-off
ooh, goes through. Very flat and quick outside off. Rossouw is hanging back to a ball he should have been forward to. No turn means the ball goes past the edge
flight on off, driven to cover
lots of air and loop outside off, clipped to long-on with the turn
a low full toss on off is pushed to long-on
steered with an angled bat to third man. Too wide from Holder
nicely played. A good length delivery outside off. Rossouw pushes to long-on, dragged it slightly but manufactured the run
another full toss. Mis-hit to cover
change in pace. A slower delivery outside off is shovelled to cover. If Ab is struggling for timing, it says something about the nature of this surface
punched to long-on from the back foot
well played. Opens the face of the full delivery to find the gap at point. Just one but class batting
tossed up outside off, Rossouw gets low for a paddle but the ball strikes him on the pad well outside off
nicely bowled. Tossed up outside off, gets a bit of turn. A thick outside edge on the bounce to slip
overpitched on off, mis-hit so badly to long-off that they get two
again, opens the bat face to guide the ball to wide cover. Use of the wrists key to batting in these conditions
driven with the spin to long-on
more signs of the slowness. A fullish delivery stops on Rossouw who bunts it back to the bowler
offcutter outside off, thick outside edge to third man for a couple
nicely bowled. Full on off, blocked back
yorker on off, jammed back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, driven back with a straight bat to the bowler
another slower ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket for a run
flight outside off, nudged away to long-on
nice length that. Slightly shorter on of, AB goes back and cuts to point. Plenty of turn
flat on off, pushed to cover. WI getting through their overs rather quickly
flat on off, blocked
overly full on off, driven with the spin to long-off
nicely whipped towards square leg for a run. Dragged it from outside off
there is No. 1. Slow outside off, slapped to long-off
No. 2. An offcutter is mis-directed. Full toss on the pads is easily tucked to square leg
slightly too wide. Thrashed to wide long-off
superb running. On-driven. pollard gets across with a dive but lets the ball go through. Rossouw had already set off before the ball go through. As a result, he gets back for the second
109 kph, full on off, pushed back to the bowler
another slower ball outside off, blocked
superb. Outside off, Rossouw reverse-laps past the keeper for a couple. Did not bother over-hitting, just placed
flat down leg, worked down to fine leg
a fine sweep to short fine leg. Taylor lets it through, allowing the extra run
a mis-timed reverse lap to third man
flat on off, a thick inside edge to midwicket
shortish on off, punched to long-off, via a misfield from cover
slower ball on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
another slower ball outside off, punched back to the bowler.
Pollard goes wide of the crease and executes a wide yorker. Rossouw misses
a slow full toss is drilled to long-on. Taylor again mis-fields. Holder with his hands on his hips. Lazy, sloppy fielding.
a slower ball is punched to long-on
slow to finish. Quite full outside off and glided to wide cover. Played that well, opened the bat face
flatter trajectory on middle. Rossouw plays with the turn to fine leg. Waited on that nicely
shot! Opened up his stance, and then his bat face to hit to deep cover
flat on off, punched back
another reverse lap.Lets the flat delivery slide onto his reverse-angled bat. Taylor fumbles again, but no damage done
lovely batting. Tip and run towards silly point
flat on middle, blocked
strays down leg immediately. Helped along past short fine leg for a few runs - two
full and straight, the straight bat is presented to on-drive to long-on
a low full toss, driven to long-on easily

dropped. And a misfield. A very hard chance though. Full on off, smashed back at Taylor, like earlier in the day. Taylor gets his hands up but the ball ricochets off towards mid-off where there is a fumble
too full, drilled to long-on
good change-up. Full and wide, Rossouw taken aback by the line, reaches out for it but misses
tossed up on off, AB opens the bat face to guide to point
shorter and wider outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
flat on middle, 91 kph, tucked to midwicket
slowish on off, driven to deep cover again. Slow and steady from SA. A platform set
steered to third man after allowing the ball to turn back into him
lovely stop from Pollard. Flat on middle, pushed to cover where Pollard puts in a dive to save one
good length outside off, punched off the back foot to wide mid-off. An easy run
full and wide, thrashed to wide mid-off again
yorker outside off. Rossouw misses his dab to third man
another yorker. Well executed. Dug out towards cover
full and wide outside off, slapped from one knee to deep cover. Still no boundary for quite a while
yorker outside off, bunted to mid-off. Another dot ball
very flat and full outside off, Rossouw misses his reverse sweep and is struck on the pads well outside off
slow this time on off, pushed towards silly point. AB yells "no"
nurdled away to fine leg
slow and tossed up on off, pushed to cover
punched off the back foot to deep cover. Utilising ht depth of the crease nicely
reverse slapped for four. Yes, four. F-O-U-R. Boundary. Rososuw gets down low and times his reverse sweep nicely behind point. Almost didn't get there

gone! Taylor holds on. Massive wicket. Humongous wicket. A very typical wicket in these conditions. Full on off, AB is through the drive a tad too early. Hits it well towards Taylor who sticks out his hands and the ball sticks in his left hand, near his face. A big, flashy smile. Huge moment in the game
fullish on off, tapped to point
full on off, driven to mid-off. Tight lines these, good bowling from Taylor
slower delivery on leg, clipped towards square leg. Played that with soft-enough hands to get two.
nicely timed. A half-volley outside off is creamed to deep cover
too full again outside off, laced away in front of cover for a couple
JP gets down low and paddle sweeps to fine leg for two. Great batting immediately
another paddle sweep to fine leg. Two more.
another one. This time just one
fifty for Rossouw, well played. Punched in front of point to get to his landmark. Quality rebuilding innings but work to be done
shortish and wide, steered to point
Rossouw came a long way down before being sent back. Tossed up on off, pushed to point. JP sends him back just in time
shortish and width outside off, possibly a slower ball, Rossouw flat-bats it back to the bowler. Mis-hit
that's another boundary. That's a four! Languid and pleasing on the eye. Ricky errs too full and outside off, the batsman gets forward and drives it past the covers
Ricky drags his length back outside off, it does not rise at all. Pulled away past midwicket for two
change-up. Ricky rolls his fingers across this one. Almost a yorker length cutter from the back of the hand. Squeezed to square leg
slower one down the leg side, deflected behind to the keeper
looks like a slower one again on middle, dabbed to midwicket with soft hands for one
darted outside off, whipped wide of midwicket
turns away from the left-hander, worked to the same region
straighter one, pushed to the off side on the front foot
tapped to the point region. Scurried off for a single
drifting down the leg side, paddled fine past the keeper. Tickles it. Off the batsman's glove, kisses the keeper's glove, and sneaks away
that's a ripaah! This pitches on middle and breaks away outside off past the groping bat. The batsman was left c-l-u-e-l-e-s-s. Narine still has the fizz
overpitched and just outside off, drilled to long-off
cuts back into Duminy, pace off the ball from the back of the hand, dabbed behind square
slower short ball outside off, waits and pulls to deep square leg
back of a length and on middle, Duminy punches a single to long-on
shorter and just outside off, carved away to sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, does not come onto the batsman, Duminy slashes a single to the cover-point region
Duminy bends and sweeps this tossed up ball towards fine leg

offbreak again, opens up Rossouw and induces the edge. Nicked to slip. Good, low catch from Ricky. Narine has his second. This turned away from the left-hander, who prodded without moving his feet. Ricky snaffles the outside edge. Credit to Holder as well - he has a slip in the 36th over
tossed around off, defended gingerly

and Narine gets FB for a duck! Pushed through on middle, FB hangs back and does not meet with a flick. Hit on the front pad in line with middle. The tracker shows that it would have nailed the middle stump. The finger goes up. A few WI fans dancing and jiving in the stands
fizzes just outside off, ignored
straight roller, clipped to mid-on. What an over from Narine. Two wickets
short and wide outside off, cut to backward point, diving save
back of a length and outside off, run away past the diving Ramdin, fine on the off side
full on middle, flicked straight to midwicket
back of a length on off, defended back to the bowler
low full toss, punched ram-rod straight, so much so it hits the stumps at the bowler's end
Duminy leans back and chops this length ball from outside off to third man
too full and outside off, driven to long-off
may have been a knuckle ball around off, defended onto the pitch
skidded off the deck outside off, beats the cut
flatter on off, pushed back to Narine
shorter and quicker outside off, 94ks, chopped straight to backward point
biting offbreak, curls back in, Morris jabs his bat down in defence. Narine still has it!
full on middle, tapped back to the bowler
angled into the toes, tucked to Big Ben at short midwicket. Duminy had set off for a single but is forced to undo his steps
full and angled in on middle, driven nicely but straight to mid-off
off-stump full toss, whipped to long-on
yorker on off, toe-ended to cover
Holder goes wide of the crease and angles this full ball in on middle, flicked through square leg
arm-ball, drifts in, worked to square leg
down the track and whipped to long-on
Morris pre-mediates, bends low, scoops it. Does not carry to short fine leg
shorter and outside off, forced to long-off
JP now pre-meditates, goes low, and reverse-paddles this straighter ball to left of short third man. Ricky makes a sprawling save
turn! Breaks away past the defensive prod of Morris. Beaten
angled into the pads, flicked out to Benn at short midwicket
fuller and outside off, drives it to sweeper cover
half-volley outside off, Morris leans forward and drives it to long-off
116.7ks offbreak outside off, zips away outside off. Duminy leans forward, pushes, and misses. This gripped in the surface
chopped on! Another back of a length cutter, JP aimed to cut it away. He played his shot early and played it onto the stumps. Undone by the slowness of the surface
full and straight, twirled to midwicket
slides on outside off, chopped to backward point
the batsman shuffles across off and manipulates a couple to midwicket
dangled outside off, reverse-sweeps and does not connect
shorter and outside off, chopped only to cover
full and aimed at off, driven only to cover
shoots low outside off, slows this up, Morris still can't beat cover
full on the stumps, driven down the ground for one
change of pace outside off, 118ks, back of a length, dabbed to cover
full toss, bunted to long-on
looks like a slower ball from the back of the hand. Was that a legcutter? Knocked softly to square leg
back of a length and outside off, tapped to short extra cover
angled in full on middle, chipped down to long-on
drifts in and turns away a touch around off, Benn induces an outside edge that dribbles to point
slides in with the angle, jabbed towards the covers
straighter one, reverse-slapped straight to point
curls in, fuller in length, inside-edged onto the front pad
Benn nails a blockhole ball on middle. Jammed out
loopier and slower, nudged to cover. Tidy effort from Benn. He din't pick up a wicket in his 10 overs but complemented Narine well
knuckle ball outside off, poked to cover
stabbed to the off side again
sharp offbreak, comes in and raps the back pad, but it was doing too much to hit the stumps
dangled outside off at 93.4ks, driven down the ground
breaks in again, off the thigh and rolls to short fine leg

plumb in front! Sharp offbreak again, raps the back pad even before Morris' bat came down to chop it to the off side. The finger goes up! Morris wants a review, perhaps out of desperation. Hit in line. It would have hit middle. Umpire Wilson's call is vindicated
The middle and leg stumps are floored. Skiddy full ball, zips in, beats the defences of Abbott and makes a mess of his stumps
full and outside off from round the wicket, Ricky finds the outside edge. Down to third man
full and on the pads, picked away behind square for two
slower legcutter outside off, stabbed to cover
quick back of a length ball, played to point
back of a length and angled in, an inside edge rolls down fine on leg
knuckle ball, defended on the front foot to cover
dabbed to cover with an open face from off stump

Five wickets on international return for Sunil Narine. He has his hands aloft. He lobs this one up outside off, invites the lower-order batsman to go for a big hit. He flashes a drive and Big Holder completes the overhead catch at short extra cover. Holder leapt and used his height to grab that
turning down the leg side, beats the batsman and keeper as well
offbreak, pushed back

Narine ends the innings with a wicket. Make that six on international return for Narine. But, this looked like it was slipping down leg. Dangled up on middle and turns in, the batsman swipes and misses. The tracker shows that it would have turned past leg

inn2.comm: starts with a wide outswinger that only deviates further away. Should have been called wide, too far outside off
a good length delivery outside off, pushed to point, bat away from body. Lazy technique

edged and dropped. A genuine opportunity, and one that should have been taken. Good length outside off, an outswinger. Charles pokes away from his body again and gets a thick outside edge. Straight to 1st slip, but there isn't one. Only Amla at wide slip, who dives away but de Kock dives in front and parries it to the third man boundary
pushed to mid-off
edged again and over slip this time. Good intent from Charles, he looks for a bit mow over mid-on but the ball skews off a thick outside edge, flying over Amla at a wide slip
pushed to point from the crease. A good over from Abbott
nice run. Back of a length down leg, clipped towards square leg for one
another edge, another boundary. This time, all along the ground and past slip. Fullish and wide outside off
quite full on off, driven to mid-off
a wild swing. Fullish on middle, Charles tries to swipe it away but misses as the ball strikes him in the midriff area.
back of a length on middle, hustling Charles for pace who awkwardly pulls to square leg. Wants one but is sent back in time
spooned to square leg. All action for Charles. Hurries for pace again, he tries to pull but the ball lobs off towards square leg
full and wide, well left. Respect shown
beauty. Good pace too. 137 kph. Good length outside off, Fletcher plays inside the line slightly and is beaten
inviting the drive with a full delivery outside off, left alone
pushed into the cover area, from the crease
beaten. Good bowling this, troubling Fletcher with that nagging line outside off. Beaten again. Not much movement though
nice end. Full and wide, left alone
strays in line. Thuds off the pad, towards fine leg for two leg byes
stops in the surface. Maybe Charles played too early. Either way, plenty of opportunities for SA. Bunted to mid-off from a good length
short delivery, nice change-up. Swivel-pulled to fine leg
Fletcher is unconvincing as well. A shortish length outside off, Fletcher shapes to cut but bails out of the stroke just in time
very close. A full length delivery is tapped towards point. Good response from Charles, the point fielder is very quick on it and a direct hit may have had him
a belated appeal from Rabada. Yorker on off, Charles jams it out in time. Bat-pad or pad-bat? AB isn't keen on the review.
full on off, nagging away at that off bail. Pushed to mid-on
left alone outside off, not bothering with too many there
slogged badly. But in the gap at midwicket. Wanted to go straight but the ball skews off the inside half towards midwicket
play and miss outside off yet again. This time, plenty of width so the cut was on. Charles just misses
rather full on off, blocked
shortens the length this time. Brings it closer to off but glided to point
nicely bowled. Outside off at a hustling pace. Fletcher is beaten
good length on a sixth-stump line. Blocked into the off side. Boom or bust for WI in this innings so far
short and wide, left alone
nice change-up. Rabada using that variation nicely. Bouncer on middle, Fletcher ducks
looks for that yorker this time. So full, Fletcher looks for a big drive but gets his bat down on it just in time. A thick inside edge. Hands on head from Rabada
short and wide, slapped to third man. Fletcher races back for two, good running
overly full on middle, a thick inside edge to fine leg for a run
nice intention. Full on off, Fletcher goes up and over mid-off with a nice swing. Mis-timed nut enough to get over AB, who knocks it off towards the boundary, but recovers excellently
good length outside off, Fletcher tries to hit through the off side but the sluggish pitch results in a miscue back to the bowler
yes. well bowled. Another well-executed yorker on off, jammed out.
good length outside off, swatted to square leg stylishly
full and wide outside off, blocked. Fletcher examines the toe-end of his bat, not the first batsman today to do so
defended from the crease. Tight lines.
slower delivery but still tight on off, 135 kph. Nudged to square leg
another bouncer. Well-directed. Forces Charles to hurry underneath
laced away but straight to point. Short and wide, scythed away into the ground. Timing good, placement not so much

what has happened there? Another superb yorker. 141 kph. Direct on the back foot. Muted appeal. A lot of hesitation, but that looked out as well. Still no review. They have to have thought that there was bat first
another bouncer to finish. Charles ducks
nice start. Good length outside off, blocked into the off side
shortish length on middle, Charles misses his swipe. Struggling for any timing or fluency
full on off, Charles misses a nudge. Struck on the back thigh.
back of a length on middle, helped on its way to fine leg
Fletcher shuffles across and the leg-side delivery clips the pad. A leg bye to square leg
a very awkward shot but he gets four. A good length delivery outside off, Charles swats it somehow into the gap at midwicket. A checked stroke.
a half-volley outside off is smeared to point
beautiful. A legcutter rips past the outside edge. Well bowled from Rabada
back of a length outside off, tapped to point from the back foot
drifts down leg for an extra
another slower delivery on off, properly defended
nice-looking stroke. Full and wide, punched to extra cover from the crease
looking for that yorker again. Misses. Low full toss, jammed to mid-on for one
overpitched on off, squeezed to midwicket
143.6 kph. Good length on off, chopped towards point. Fletcher wants one but Charles doesn't
short on middle, flat-batted to square leg
another short one, this one deviated down leg. Charles is late on the pull. Misses
full and wide outside off, Charles played but withdrew the stroke late
jammed towards backward point for another run
starts with a low full toss, driven to long-off
some flight on off, defended comfortably
overpitched on off, driven back to the bowler. Not very good cricket from Fletcher, not even looking for singles

and that is what happens. A superb googly from Tahir on off, Fletcher pokes loosely. Bat away from pad. The googly swerves between the bat and body and thuds into the stumps. Tahir is ecstatic. End of a stuttering innings
flat, full, defended
another googly, goes past the outside edge of Bravo who wears a smile on his face
full and wide, steered towards backward point. JP makes a run-saving dive
glided off the open face to point
nowhere near short enough to pull. Good length on leg, Charles pulls but misses as the ball clatters into his body
yorker, sliding down leg though. An optimistic appeal
overpitched on off, smeared to midwicket
jabbed to deep midwicket for a couple. Picked the good length early there and dragged it into the leg side
too full outside off, drilled to sweeper cover to get off the mark
flat and quick outside off, pushed to cover
87 kph, slower outside off, extracts a bit of turn. Pushes to cover
driven to cover with the spin
the googly this time, swerves in and hit Charles on the pad., sliding down leg though
another googly, down leg. Charles fails to pick it again. Off the pad towards midwicket
lots of flight outside off, pushed towards short point. Qdk scurries to it but can't return an accurate throw at the batsman's end
slowish on middle, bunted to midwicket
ripping turn. Pitches on leg, Charles closes the bat face too early and a thick leading edge falls short of cover
driven to long-off
flat and full, blocked
nice finish. More flight on off, Bravo strides forward to block
flat outside off, a thick outside edge races away towards the third man boundary but Abbott runs it down to save one
well bowled. The legbreak outside off. Blocked
overpitched, drilled to cover
some flight there on off, pushed away to cover. Very tight stuff
clipped past short fine leg for a couple. Some hesitation. Charles wanted to see if it got past the fielder
very full, smeared to point
quite flat, quite short, quite easily worked to midwicket
tossed up outside off, Charles drags the sweep to backward square leg for a couple. Good shot, trying to put the bowler off
tossed up on leg, some turn. Blocked
shortish and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
misjudges the length. Full and wide, Bravo goes back instead of coming forward, but steers to third man
nice end. Flight on off is defended
the googly, picked easily. Thrashed to deep point
great fielding. Flat on off, Charles backed away and under-edged to Phangiso who got around nicely to stop the runs

another googly, another wicket. The pressure was building. Googly outside off, Charles comes down and the ball sneaks in between a thin gap. Clatters into the stumps again, and off goes Tahir on his celebratory sprint
flat, yorker. A thick outside edge towards third man for a run
a quicker skiddier delivery on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
a thick inside edge to square leg off the flighted legbreak. Bravo wants one, sent back by MS
tossed up on off, driven comfortably to cover
flatter and wider outside off, Samuels leaves

flat and given. Samuels accepts the decision. He is gone. A flat and full delivery on leg, Samuels plants his front foot forward and the ball skids on with the arm to thud into the pad in front of leg. May have skidded down leg, but with umpire's call a plausible outcome, seemed a good decision not to review.
some flight outside off, driven to long-off
slower and shorter outside off, skewed to midwicket
driven with the turn to long-on
overpitched outside off, pummeled but straight to cover
nicely bowled. Flat on off, blocked
a naughty full toss and Bravo slogs it behind square and gets four. A much-needed boundary for WI
more flight. Bravo lunges forward in defense
the skiddy, flat delivery down leg. A bit of an inside edge fetches Bravo three to fine leg.
very quick on middle, pushed to long-on. A productive over for WI
85 kph flight on leg, squeezed to midwicket
short and slow outside off, Ramdin goes back and slaps to cover
nicely bowled. Some loop on middle and leg, blocked
good batting. Short and wide, scythed to deep point
flat on a fifth-stump line. Bravo goes back to try to cut but miscues it badly. Too slow to cut with ease
just one of the over. Slow on middle and off, blocked
oh yes. Full on middle and off, tailing back in late. Somehow Ramdin keeps it out. Maybe some reverse swing possible with the abrasive nature of the pitch
short and wide, a loose offering. Laced to extra cover
tries to dab one to third man but the good length delivery goes past the edge
well played. Allows the ball to come to him before deflecting to third man
good length on off, punched to point
another tight over. Full and wide, Bravo misses an exuberant thrashy drive
short and wide, thwacked to deep point with a cut
slower on middle, worked to midwicket
nicely tossed up again. Nudged into the leg side again
nicely nurdled, off his pads to backward square leg
more flight. Ramin lunges forward, trying to power  drive but finds cover
flat on off to finish. Blocked. Just two off it
steered past point. Amla scurries across from third man and prevents the two.
full and wide, hit powerfully but straight to extra cover.
nice change-up. Short legcutter outside off, Ramdin leaves
full and straight, pushed to mid-on. Another dot. Something has got to give
gets a gap this time, just the two though. Shortish and wide, Ramdin hangs back and punches a drive past cover
good single. Worked to wide mid-on and called for one immediately. Made it with ease. Good intent
flat on leg, skids on with the arm. Inside-edged to fine leg
almost carries back to the bowler. Tossed up on leg, bunted back to the bowler
short and wide, cut away to deep point
flat down leg, would have been wide had he not flicked to leg slip
tossed up on off, pushed into the off side
edged and dropped. A thick outside edge goes past de Kock's gloves for a couple to third man
sliding into the pads from round the wicket, tucked behind square
drifts it full, this time on the left-hander's pads, turned square on the leg side

slapped into the lap of AB. Duminy strikes third ball. Slides across the right hander from round the stumps. Ramdin leans back and hits it hard to short extra cover. Juggled take from the SA captain. The spinners are turning it on at the Providence. AB took into on the second attempt
pushed through on middle and leg, glanced to square leg
'Hello, JP' says Pollard. That's the first six of the match. Floated outside off, in the hitting arc. Bottom-handed thump over long-on
skiddy offbreak, keeps Pollard back. Tapped to midwicket
leg-side wide
tossed around off, patted back to the bowler
clipped off the pads to short fine leg
veers in on middle and leg, knocked to leg for one
floated on middle, Pollard presents a high elbow, punches it. Pinged straight down the ground for six
and again! Third six for KP. Drifts in with the arm, launched over long-on again
nudged to the right of that fielder for one
overpitched and outside off, creamed to the covers
full and heading down leg, KP glances and misses... The caught-behind appeal is shot down. The ball may have kissed the pad on its way to the keeper. Qdk is shocked at the call
full and outside off, sliced to point, where there is a misfield
pretty full and zeroed in on off, driven to mid-off for a speedy single
angled into the pads from round the wicket, eased to long leg
short and angled in, drop-and-run single to midwicket. Rossouw attacks the ball. He jammed his right knee. It got stuck in the turf, creating an indentation
off-stump yorker, dug out
full and sprayed down leg, helped fine on its way. Morris' slide in the deep ends in vain. 4 leg byes actually
dug in on off, KP defends it to cover
back of a length and angled in, blocked to the same region
rising short ball on off, KP gets on top of the bounce and fends it to short midwicket. He was off for a quick single but KP is sent back by Bravo. There was no run there. Good call from Bravo
full on middle, punched back to the bowler
banged in on off again, fended to Rossouw at short midwicket
angled in from around the stumps, blocked to the leg side
short and angled in on off, chopped towards short third man
Pollard ventures down the track, the bowler pulls his length back. Guided in front of short cover. The fielder runs in and fumbles, giving away a single
shorter and some width, slapped out to point
short and more width, cut firmly to sweeper cover
too straight in line, glanced to long leg
yorker on off, dug behind the wicket to Qdk. KG has overstepped

and Pollard makes use of it. Beats Tahir at wide long-on. Fans doing the champion jig in the stands. Back of a length and outside off, skips back and pummels it over the boundary, beating Tahir running to his right
back of a length on off, punched back to the bowler
fuller on off, cracked to long-on
leg-side wide
off-stump ball, open-faced dab to backward point
picked away off the pads to fine leg
slower short ball outside off, 113ks, KP waits patiently and then runs it down to third man
bouncer on the leg stump, forces KP to half-duck out of the way
dipping full toss on off, bunted to mid-on
inducker, inside-edged to the leg side, rolls to square leg
yorker, tails in, jammed out past midwicket
difficult to grip the ball? Leg-side wide, this time from Morris
full and drifts into leg stump, Bravo seeks to flick and ends up missing it. Off the pad and rolls in front of cover
overpitched on middle, driven to the off side
googly, swerves in, Pollard hangs back and blocks it to leg
quicker, full ball, driven hard to long-off
floated on off, Bravo dead-bats it
loopier on middle, dabbed to cover
slides on the leg stump, blocked on the back foot
full and outside off, stylish drive to long-off
full and outside off, Bravo watches it through to Qdk
short on off, glides it to point
angling into the pads, deflected through square leg... for two. Good urgency and these two are eating into the target
short and angled in, fended to point
punched past point now to the right of sweeper
back of a length on off, KP gets right behind the line
slides on middle, no turn, tucked to midwicket
darted on middle, nudging 96ks, kept out
poked out to short third man
off-side wide
this dew-slicked ball slides on off, Bravo unleashes a full swing and hits it down the ground
googly, leaves the left-hander, and beats the outside edge. Bravo did not pick it
legbreak down leg
biting offbreak, raps the pad
punched down to long-on for one
back of a length and angled in, open-faced dab to point
guided to point again
back of a length on off, played to point
full and outside off, flat-batted to mid-off
width outside off, slapped to point
zipping googly, drifts in, KP manages an inside snick onto the pad and survives
legbreak now outside off, KP aims to drive and ends up slicing over the covers
tossed on off, looks like a googly, clears long-on with a lofted hit. Pollard did not pick it and mis-hit that
another googly, knocked to square leg
flat on middle, jammed to cover
pushed through on middle, played to mid-on
slower ball on the leg stump, KP glances it... Qdk dives and stops the ball
veering into the hips, worked behind square
full on middle, picked away to midwicket
pitched up on off, driven to cover
off-stump yorker, jabbed back to the bowler
slower ball just outside off, 120ks, dabbed towards backward point
short and angled in on middle, crisp punch to long-on for one
spinning big down the leg side, wide

Phangiso gets Bravo lbw.  Umpire Illingworth's finger goes up. Bravo challenges the decision immediately. Pushed through on middle, Bravo prods and misses. No inside edge. Looks quite adjacent to the stumps. The tracker shows the it would have hit middle. Umpire's call prevails. Bravo has to go
drifts in on off, dabbed from the crease behind square on off
slides on of, blocked
tossed up, kept out
Ricky winds up for a massive swipe and misses. This kisses the back pad and runs past the leg stump, beating the keeper
full and angled in, Pollard stays back and pokes it to the leg side via an inside edge
short on middle, helped to fine leg. Pollard makes a half-century on return to international cricket. It has been a day for the comeback men. First Narine, now KP
full and outside off, Ricky stabs and does not connect
length ball on middle, Ricky clears his front leg and thwacks it inside out over the covers. One-bounce four
length ball around off, glided down to third man
straight in line, Pollard strides forward and turns it to the midwicket region
hint of turn outside off, dabbed wide of slip
pushed through on off, defended
darted on middle, forced down to long-on
skiddy ball on off, clipped to midwicket
shorter on off, stands tall and punches to long-on
flighted on middle, Pollard clears his front leg, gets under it and swings it over long-off. He finishes the over with a belted six
Ricky moves outside leg, the bowler follows him with a yorker that tails in. Jammed to the leg side
banged in short on off, Pollard rises with it and drops it to the cover region
full on off, stops on KP, checked push to the off side
full toss veers in and beats the flick. Rapped on the pad, but this was heading down leg
lifting ball on middle, helped with the wrists behind square on the leg side
slower ball, but KG pushes it too full. Biffed past mid-off
defended back to the bowler
chopped to short third man
tossed on off, Brathwaite swings.... He gets more height instead of distance. He was deceived in flight. Holes out to long-on
loopier on middle, dabbed gently towards point
pushed back to the bowler
slower through the air, Holder defends it to cover
fired on off, slider, blocked back
floats it up wide outside off, Pollard swipes and only connects with thin air. The legbreak is wided
sharp legbreak, curves away outside off with extra bounce, skirts past the outside edge
legbreak, lobbed outside off, invites the big hit. Pollard swings but makes no contact
follows it with the wrong'un. Defended back
low full toss on off, pushed down to long-on for one
looks like the googly, comes in and catches the pad, but was drifting down leg
slower cutter outside off, 110ks, waited and tapped to cover
short and outside off, played up to short extra cover
back of a length and stops outside off, check pushed to the off side
full on middle, Holder gets behind the line in defence
floated full outside off, helped down to third man
loopy cutter, dabbed in front of point. Pollard sets off... Pollard is near the middle of the pitch and gives up. A direct hit at the striker's end could have got the batsman. Abbott has a wry mile
lovely legbreak draws the right-hander forward and beats the outside edge
too full on off, squeezed to the covers
another legbreak, which is carved through the covers
too full and outside off, driven to deep cover
short and the googly turns down leg, off the thigh maybe and Qdk is beaten
eased to long-off as this was full and outside off
back of a length on off, heaved to the leg side off the inside half
yorker on middle, slower yorker at 112ks, dips and tests the batsman. Jammed out
full and shoots low outside off, beats the batsman
full toss on middle, milked down to long-on
back of a length and outside off, chopped down to third man. Positive running. Two. Weak throw from Morris in the deep
slower cutter on off, squeezed out to point
floated full on middle, tapped to long-on
back of a length on middle, punched to midwicket
short roller, slapped to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, punched to long-off
Holder backs away outside leg and the bowler follows him. Bunted to midwicket
and again. He moves outside leg, FB chases him. Slapped to long-on
Holder seals the win for WI. He ventures down the track and loft-drives Duminy over the covers
